content: row of the ridge by slipping two stitches instead of one at the join one stitch will be decreased on every sixth ridge repeat these six ridges until you only have three stitches left from now on knit the first outside stitch of every ridge rather than slipping it at two stitches work five more joining ridges i know they re tiny and then slip both stitches knitwise and join fasten_off and darn in the tail to the end of the next couple of ridges on the hat that was fairly simple - the same as the adult hat but with fewer plain rounds knitting a smaller hat is a bit different as the shaping has to start earlier the small hat the first few stages of this one are the same as for the other hats knit the beginning circle and then increase back up to ten stitches as before 7 the first round ridge 1 k8 w&t k8 ridges 2 & 3 k9 join k9 repeat these three ridges all round the circle until you get back to your safety pin the hat will already have started to curve downwards this round is what makes this hat so much smaller plain rounds now work just two plain rounds as before every ridge k9 join k9 move your safety pin over to the new outside ridge to mark the start and end of each round after first plain round after second plain round 8 to finish the hat follow the instructions on page 7 to taper the bottom edge of the brim the finished hat kindly modelled by my 56 year old tiny tears doll the yarn used this time was king cole baby print 4 ply 400 m / 100g shade 3262 rainbow and i used 2 75 mm needles again abbreviations k knit kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch sl 2 decrease kwise slip two stitches together knitwise w&t wrap and turn see page 2 join see page 4 © frankie brown © 2024 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtoknititems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission 9
